intro: Tapura antillana, commonly known as the Caribbean tapura, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a hairy texture. Tapura antillana is adapted to grow in coastal and wetland environments, thriving in humid, tropical climates.
